MAIN_YHX_72_6: ...Well, to put in your words, I guess I'm thinking about my homeland.
MAIN_YHX_72_7: Then… do you wanna go back for a visit?
MAIN_YHX_72_11: …Can I tell you a secret, {PlayerName}? After Mom and Dad went away, my chest always felt all tight and heavy.
MAIN_YHX_72_12: When people in the tribe talked to me, their voices always sounded really far away...
MAIN_YHX_72_13: But that day at the lake... after I cried in front of you... the feeling got a little smaller. I didn't feel so bad.
MAIN_YHX_72_14: I know you can't say this stuff to other people. 'Cause they all think you're super strong.
MAIN_YHX_72_15: But I'm just a kid! And I don't think you're that strong! So... if you need to cry, you can cry with me. I'm really good at keeping secrets.
MAIN_YHX_72_16: So... you don't have to be sad by yourself. Okay?
MAIN_YHX_72_17: My homeland is far, far away, Aemeath.
MAIN_YHX_72_21: The people there gave me a mission. That's why I came here.
MAIN_YHX_72_22: Hm… what kind of mission? It must be really important to come so far.
MAIN_YHX_72_24: To do whatever needs to be done to fulfill the mission, for as long as it takes.
MAIN_YHX_72_27: But… talking with you makes it not so bad.
MAIN_YHX_72_28: There's still a lot I have to do in this world. This won't stop me. Don't worry about me, Aemeath.
MAIN_YHX_72_31: I'm your family too. Until you find your real family and can go back to your homeland, I'll be right here with you!
MAIN_YHX_72_34: Ha... a dream of the old days.
MAIN_YHX_72_36: It's complicated. Too complicated for you right now.
MAIN_YHX_72_37: Then just pick a simpler way to say it! ...I'll listen really carefully.
MAIN_YHX_72_38: Put in terms of your Space Fantasy Katya games... I came here to save the world.
MAIN_YHX_72_39: But was it the right thing for me?
MAIN_YHX_72_40: Because one day I realized I would never return home.
MAIN_YHX_72_41: I couldn't stop thinking about that faraway place. More than I ever had before.
MAIN_YHX_72_42: In what you'd call dreams, I'd go back. Stand there, just stare at what I once called my homeland...
MAIN_YHX_72_43: Even if staring didn't change a thing. Even if it was pointless.
MAIN_YHX_72_46:
In the past, young Aemeath would wake up at night and come to your side, anxious about being worried about you. She listened to your woes about being homesick and promised to stay by your side as family.
Now, woken from the dream, anger flickers in Aemeat's eyes at the very word "homeland."
MAIN_YHX_73_1: Morning! Off to see the Exostrider we go!
MAIN_YHX_74_1: The Exostrider is surrounded by water. Perfect chance to test out that bike Dr. Luuk modified for us!
MAIN_YHX_75_1: Aemeath, once you get all your power back, will people be able to see you again?
MAIN_YHX_75_2: Hard to say. There's no precedent for my situation. It's all just theory.
MAIN_YHX_75_3: But what if it works? What would you want to do then?
MAIN_YHX_75_4: Hmm, haven't decided! But I'm definitely going on a proper tour of the Academy!
MAIN_YHX_75_5: If that happens, can you come with me?
MAIN_YHX_9041_1: (Looks like a long way. Better take the bike.)
MAIN_YHX_9053_2: I will not let you near {Male=him;Female=her} again.
MAIN_YHX_104_2: Oh, are you talking to me?
MAIN_YHX_104_3: I just heard the most hilarious story. Couldn't help myself!
MAIN_YHX_104_4: Since you asked, how 'bout I tell you?
MAIN_YHX_104_5: Once upon a time, there was a black cat who set out to save the world.
MAIN_YHX_104_6: Why? Because everyone told the cat it was a savior!
MAIN_YHX_104_7: The cat didn't get it. When it opened its big golden eyes, it was just stuck in this tiny cardboard box.
MAIN_YHX_104_8: And inside that tiny box? It was crammed full of even tinier little creatures! The cat was shocked. It had to tiptoe around, careful not to step on anyone.
MAIN_YHX_104_9: These tiny creatures, even living in their tiny box, had so much misery. So many disasters. Constantly just... waiting for the other shoe to drop.
MAIN_YHX_104_10: "Please save us!" they begged the cat. And, of course, the cat agreed.
MAIN_YHX_104_11: Even if they hadn't asked, the cat would've helped anyway. Because that's who the cat believed it was: a savior!
MAIN_YHX_104_12: And so, the cat took up its sword. Always fighting, always talking, always roving…
MAIN_YHX_104_13: ...Saving the world, over and over. Until one day, it realized the cardboard box had been sealed shut.
MAIN_YHX_104_14: Hahaha! Isn't that kind of laughable?
MAIN_YHX_104_17: Right?! It's just a cat! Why did it have to do all of that?!
MAIN_YHX_104_18: Where's your sense of humor! Isn't it absurd? The sheer ridiculousness of everyone ignoring the fact that it's just a cat?
MAIN_YHX_104_19: But in such a laughable story, somehow... everyone else gets to be happy.
MAIN_YHX_104_20: The ones who relied on the cat, the ones who hated the cat...  they all got exactly what they wanted.
MAIN_YHX_104_22: It wants to go home, but no one remembers. The box is sealed shut, and the ones who put the cat in there have already turned their backs on it.
MAIN_YHX_104_23: Even the cat itself has forgotten.
MAIN_YHX_104_24: Heh… isn't that... so absurdly laughable?
MAIN_YHX_104_25:
Aemeath's laughter echoes inside the classroom as she leans back in a chair and tells you a story about a black cat saving the world.
"Do you think this cat that's inside this box, whom everyone calls a savior, is laughable?" She asks while giving you the eyebrow, yet you feel she is actually crying.
MAIN_YHX_105_2: There's this question that just spins and spins up. I still don't have the answer.
MAIN_YHX_105_3: Now that you're here, I want to ask you what you think.
MAIN_YHX_105_5: Family is supposed to look out for each other. Protect each other.
MAIN_YHX_105_6: So I want to do something for {Male=him;Female=her}.
MAIN_YHX_105_7: {Male=He;Female=She} doesn't say it, but I can see it. All the stuff piled up inside {Male=him;Female=her}.
MAIN_YHX_105_8: The more you hide, the less you share.
MAIN_YHX_105_9: But I saw {PlayerName} recently. And I think {Male=he;Female=she} seems more carefree than before.
MAIN_YHX_105_10: The sunlight in Jinzhou, the flowers in the Black Shores, the winds of Rinascita… {Male=He;Female=She} told me all about this new journey.
MAIN_YHX_105_11: It made me happy. Truly happy, for {Male=him;Female=her}.
MAIN_YHX_105_12: I guess... forgetting can be a blessing. If you don't remember something, it can't hurt you.
MAIN_YHX_105_13: So I started thinking... maybe I shouldn't tell {Male=him;Female=her} what I saw in Voidspace.
MAIN_YHX_105_14: All that pain {Male=he;Female=she} carried about {Male=his;Female=her} home... it's gone now. Why bring it back?
MAIN_YHX_105_15: If not knowing is happier... why ruin it?
MAIN_YHX_105_16: But… people need to know the truth.
MAIN_YHX_105_17: You're right. Happiness is what matters.
MAIN_YHX_105_18: Even if the truth destroys that happiness? I... I can't. I don't want to see {Male=him;Female=her} hurt.
MAIN_YHX_105_19: Right? Happiness is so fragile. It should be protected.
MAIN_YHX_105_21: We all need a little hope to keep going, right? I want {Male=him;Female=her} to hold onto that hope.
MAIN_YHX_105_23: It's been feeding on {PlayerName}'s frequency, trying to complete itself, spouting things that should have stayed unsaid—things that would ruin {Male=his;Female=her} peace.
MAIN_YHX_105_24: I must destroy it before it spills the truth.
MAIN_YHX_105_25: I brought it into this world. I'll be the one to take it out, too.
MAIN_YHX_105_26: Nothing truly matters. Not even saving the world.
MAIN_YHX_105_27: But you have to believe what you're doing has meaning. That's the only way to keep moving forward.
MAIN_YHX_105_29:
Filled with sadness, Aemeath sits on the classroom chair, sharing her troubles about you.
Should she tell the truth to someone who has lost their memory and pain? If they don't remember, wouldn't they suffer less? What would be wrong with that?
MAIN_YHX_106_2: ...I told you to stay out of this.
MAIN_YHX_106_3: I know you did this for me. To protect my happiness. And I'm grateful. But it's over now.
MAIN_YHX_106_5: I need to hear it. All of it. Whatever the truth is, it's my burden to carry. My choice to make.
MAIN_YHX_106_7: Carrying this on your own hasn't been easy, has it?
MAIN_YHX_106_8: Do you really want this? Even if it changes nothing? Even if… it only weighs you down?
MAIN_YHX_106_9: Things only weigh on us because they matter.
MAIN_YHX_106_11: Back when we lived together, you once told me you'd come from a faraway place. That you were on Solaris to carry out a mission.
MAIN_YHX_106_12: Current research suggests the Exostriders and Sentinels were made with technology from the same civilization. I think that civilization... is the faraway homeland you spoke of.
MAIN_YHX_106_13: You never spoke of it to me or anyone else again. So I kept it to myself… until I died and slipped into Voidspace as a digital ghost.
MAIN_YHX_106_14: As I wandered through the ruins devoured by the Threnodian, I stumbled upon a faint frequency. Your frequency.
MAIN_YHX_106_15: Time is chaotic inside Voidspace. There's no telling when it had been devoured.
MAIN_YHX_106_16: But… I could feel your warmth in it. After so long without you… I couldn't let it go. I kept it with me.
MAIN_YHX_106_17: Guided by its strange connection to other frequencies, I traced my way through countless overlapping spaces until I found the remains of an Exostrider.
MAIN_YHX_106_18: That was when I realized that Exostriders were built to transport Sentinels.
MAIN_YHX_106_19: They trekked through stars to deliver Sentinels to Solaris. Until, during one jump, the Threnodian Aleph-1 must've noticed them.
MAIN_YHX_106_20: Its hunger had festered for so long that not even devouring the entire universe could sate it now.
MAIN_YHX_106_21: That frequency then led me to another relic consumed by the Threnodian—a creation built by the same makers of the Exostriders.
MAIN_YHX_106_22: It was beyond my understanding. I could only guess its purpose: a communication satellite.
MAIN_YHX_106_23: And within its ruined shell, I discovered frequencies tied to you.
MAIN_YHX_106_24: You said you wanted to go home. Even if just to lay eyes on it, one more time.
MAIN_YHX_106_27: They were the ones who cut communications! They ignored every wish you had outside your mission! They forced you into this life of roving!
MAIN_YHX_106_29: You crossed the stars to fulfill their wish! How could they... HOW DARE THEY TREAT YOU LIKE THAT?!
MAIN_YHX_106_30: In that moment, I was... drowning in pain.
MAIN_YHX_106_31: I didn't know how to help you. I didn't know if I should tell you. I didn't know what future you'd even want.
MAIN_YHX_106_32: That's when your frequency I'd been carrying with me... it was corrupted by the Voidmatter. It tore through my power, and Sigillum was born.
MAIN_YHX_106_33: At first, it acted on nothing but the instinct to go home.
MAIN_YHX_106_34: It craved your frequency, trying to make itself whole, trying to seize access to my piloting control…
MAIN_YHX_106_35: …So it could reactivate the Exostrider and cross the Stridergate to get back home.
MAIN_YHX_106_37: This is what I've been keeping from you... I'm sorry.
MAIN_YHX_106_38: I'm glad you chose to tell me this, Aemeath.
MAIN_YHX_106_39: But don't worry. The journey I've had since losing my memories, the hope I found... that's mine to keep. No one can take that.
MAIN_YHX_106_40: "Saving the world"... I never saw it that way. The people and civilizations I met, they saved themselves. I was just there to help.
MAIN_YHX_106_42: I'm no savior who fell from the sky. And no one ever saved themselves by waiting for one. There's been plenty I couldn't do. Losses I couldn't prevent. Sacrifices I had to accept.
MAIN_YHX_106_43: But I'd do it all again. Every bit of it.
MAIN_YHX_106_44: If this was a mission from my past, I'd be lying if I said I didn't care what they thought of me now... But that's a question for later. Right now, we have more important threats to face.
MAIN_YHX_106_45: The fact that I'd choose this path even without my memories... that tells me this is who I am. I can't stand by while the Lament brings suffering. I care about this world too much.
MAIN_YHX_106_46: But... I'm afraid you'll feel alone.
MAIN_YHX_106_47: With everyone here? With you here? Not a chance.
MAIN_YHX_106_48: I will be there for everyone... As we head toward our shared future, leaving the past behind.
MAIN_YHX_106_52: The value of a mission isn't set by the one who gave it.
MAIN_YHX_106_53: The meaning of my path is mine alone to decide.
MAIN_YHX_106_54: I know where I'm going now. That's what matters, not where I started.
MAIN_YHX_106_57: The Core... it's returned to the Exostrider. It's one step closer to finally awakening.
MAIN_YHX_106_58: And you? Your power should be restored now that Sigillum is gone.
MAIN_YHX_106_59: It's more than restored. The Core's return has rebuilt my frequency from the ground up. I'm a full Exostrider Resonator now.
MAIN_YHX_106_60: So will others be able to see you now?
MAIN_YHX_106_61: That's right! Guess our little road trip movie's come to an end. Time to head back to Startorch Academy. Together!
MAIN_YHX_106_62: My original body is still gone, of course. I'll always be a ghost in the machine. But my "existence" is now strong enough to be detected.
MAIN_YHX_106_63: It's like… a faint current turning into a bright, flickering spark!
MAIN_YHX_106_64: Hearing this... it's a lot to process. I'd be lying if I said it wasn't.
MAIN_YHX_106_65: I just need time to figure out my next move. This... "homeland" of mine... even saying it feels strange to me.
MAIN_YHX_106_66: From those fragments, I saw the messages you sent home. Not about your mission, but full of longing.
MAIN_YHX_106_67: But their reply was... a rejection. Because it wasn't part of your mission. Because it was "unnecessary."
MAIN_YHX_106_68: It was born from my mind. From all my worries, my fears, everything I imagined you'd suffered.
MAIN_YHX_106_69: Exactly. The more of your frequency it consumed, the more coherent it became. I couldn't let you hear those words, so I... I tried to destroy it.
MAIN_YHX_106_70:
You stop Aemeath from giving Sigillum the killing blow and learns the truth about yourself: you came from beyond the skies, arriving on this planet for a prolonged mission, yet were rejected by your homeland.
In the end, you made your own choice and resolved Aemeath's inner conflict. She weeps in your embrace, and the strand of frequency held by Sigillum remerges with you.
The Reactor Core returns to the Exostrider, marking the end of your road trip. It's time to head back to campus.
MAIN_YHX_106_71: Jinzhou's soldiers fought through Retroact Rain till dawn.
MAIN_YHX_106_72: The Black Shores Bloom Bearers ran themselves ragged across distant lands.
MAIN_YHX_106_73: Rinascita's factions all dared to defy the Dark Tide.
MAIN_YHX_106_74: Lahai-Roi's people never stopped reaching for the stars.
MAIN_YHX_116_1: Now that your frequency is stable, what will you do next? Stay in Lahai-Roi, maybe?
MAIN_YHX_116_2: The Threnodian here needs to be dealt with first.
MAIN_YHX_116_3: Hah, of course. Typical workaholic. I knew you'd say that.
MAIN_YHX_116_4: Aleph-1… won't be an easy fight. But I believe in you. You're the one who keeps making the impossible possible.
MAIN_YHX_116_5: And after that, will you keep traveling? Any destination in mind?
MAIN_YHX_116_6: I need to think about that.
MAIN_YHX_116_8: This world you've chosen is vast. You can go anywhere.
MAIN_YHX_116_10: Yes. There's something I have to do.
MAIN_YHX_116_11: The Academy will look after you. Or you can go back to live in Bjartr Woods.
MAIN_YHX_116_12: When... when will you come back?
MAIN_YHX_116_14: But I'll come back to see you when I can. I promise.
MAIN_YHX_116_17: Then… I'll wait for you here in Lahai-Roi.
MAIN_YHX_116_18: Don't feel you have to. The world is vast. Don't let me or Lahai-Roi hold you back.
MAIN_YHX_116_19: B-but… you can live for so, so many years. What if I'm gone by the time you return—
MAIN_YHX_116_20: …Sorry. I shouldn't have said that. You should go now.
MAIN_YHX_116_24: …It's not fair. Why does it have to be you saving the world? You're always so exhausted… always getting hurt…
MAIN_YHX_116_26: I've walked through lands torn apart by the Lament. Every tear weighs me down, and every cry breaks a bit of my heart.
MAIN_YHX_116_27: Their pain is no different from mine. Neither is their joy.
MAIN_YHX_116_28: So if I can help, I will. I have to.
MAIN_YHX_116_29: Then… I'll be the one to protect you someday.
MAIN_YHX_116_31: Yes! You're not invincible! You get hurt, you get tired, you get sad… you're just like everyone else in this world.
MAIN_YHX_116_33: I'll chase off anyone who tries to hurt you! Like Katya from Space Fantasy!
MAIN_YHX_116_34: I'll become a savior, just like you.
MAIN_YHX_116_37: Alright, alright, I'll stop now. I know you're serious. And I'm listening to every word.
MAIN_YHX_116_38: I'll be counting on you then, Aemeath.
MAIN_YHX_116_40: The frequency Sigillum took is coming back. It's… not a great feeling. Abby's already helping me recover through the Tacet Mark. I'll be fine soon.
MAIN_YHX_116_41: Just close your eyes and take a nap. You deserve a little peace.
MAIN_YHX_116_45:
In the past, young Aemeath worried as the day of your departure from Lahai-Roi came closer. You explained your definition of salvation, and she proudly patted her chest, promising to protect you. You pinched her nose playfully and agreed with a smile.
Now, with Sigillum's frequency integrated into your body, you feel a bit drowsy. After chatting with Aemeath for a while, your vision gradually dims.
MAIN_YHX_117_1: (Huh? Why am I in control of Sigillum?)
MAIN_YHX_117_2: (Is it because… I absorbed its frequency?)
MAIN_YHX_118_1: (...Aemeath's mind space is even more chaotic than last time.)
MAIN_YHX_119_1: Sigillum… Back for more? Thought I made a mess of you last time.
MAIN_YHX_119_2: Hah… I can tear you apart a thousand times, but you never really die, do you? Fine. You're going to sit there and listen to me lose it!
MAIN_YHX_119_3: …After all, there's no one else to hear this.
MAIN_YHX_119_4: (I can't speak… or move… Was Sigillum incapable of speech back then?)
MAIN_YHX_119_5: You know, I found something interesting in the Exostrider's Reactor Drive.
MAIN_YHX_119_6: A message... left by my future self.
MAIN_YHX_119_7: Years ago, while sailing the stars toward Solaris, an Exostrider caught the attention of Aleph-1.
MAIN_YHX_119_8: Both of them tore through the Stridergate, clashing in the caverns deep below.
MAIN_YHX_119_9: The Exostrider has combat features, but it was still no match for Aleph-1.
MAIN_YHX_119_10: Its body was shattered, energy nearly depleted. And Voidmatter kept pouring through the Stridergate. Aleph-1 kept pushing, desperate to squeeze its whole disgusting bulk into this world…
MAIN_YHX_119_11: It was almost successful. It would've ended everything.
MAIN_YHX_119_12: But then a girl named Aemeath emerged from inside the Threnodian itself. The great savior, making her dramatic entrance at the final moment!
MAIN_YHX_119_13: The Exostrider watched her touch its Greatsword, the one pinning the Threnodian. Their resonance sent a surge of power back into the Reactor Drive.
MAIN_YHX_119_14: It turned the massive blade, forcing the Threnodian back through the Stridergate and driving a seal over it.
MAIN_YHX_119_15: But the human girl who had resonated with the Exostrider? She was dragged through the Stridergate with the Threnodian, vanishing from Solaris forever.
MAIN_YHX_119_16: (Aemeath was the key? She helped the Exostrider seal the Threnodian?)
MAIN_YHX_119_17: I was shocked at first. But the moment I stepped into Voidspace it all made sense.
MAIN_YHX_119_18: This distorted, black-hole of a realm where time and space are warped... it appeared when the Threnodian came to Solaris.
MAIN_YHX_119_19: Anything lost inside can exist in multiple moments at once. Things caught in it can be thrown into junctures of time they were never part of.
MAIN_YHX_119_20: And I… I can move through it all. The Voidmatter can't touch me!
MAIN_YHX_119_21: Haha... Do you have any idea what this means?
MAIN_YHX_119_23: It means… <color=RedD>I can use it to go back. Back to the very moment Aleph-1 descended!</color>
MAIN_YHX_119_24: Time, cause, effect… a perfect, closed loop. But my meeting with {PlayerName} all those years ago.... that wasn't the cause. It was the effect.
MAIN_YHX_119_25: Only by resonating with the Exostrider and dying as a Synchronist all those years ago, could I later become the Exostrider's true Resonator as a digital ghost.
MAIN_YHX_119_26: And only in this form could I cross Voidspace, return to the past, and power the Exostrider to save Lahai-Roi.
MAIN_YHX_119_27: And only because Lahai-Roi survived... could {PlayerName} have ever come here, rescue my younger self, and let me grow up here to become the chosen Synchronist in the first place.
MAIN_YHX_119_28: (No, I have to get Sigillum to move…! I need to stop—)
MAIN_YHX_119_29: Only I can do this. It has to be me. Just like {PlayerName}, I can't turn away from a responsibility like this.
MAIN_YHX_119_30: There's just one thing. One last wish.
MAIN_YHX_119_31: Just one more time, I want to…
MAIN_YHX_119_32:
Having merged with Sigillum's frequency, you enter Aemeath's mind once more. Here, you learn the truth she had been hiding: during the moments of the Exostrider and Aleph-1's arrival in Solaris, the Resonator named Aemeath aided in the seal's completion and was ultimately exiled along with Aleph-1's body.
Now, without her physical form, existing as a digital ghost is the only way she can avoid Voidmatter contamination, return to the past through the Voidspace, to close the causal loop, and ensure Lahai-Roi's survival.
MAIN_YHX_121_1: For over ten years now, I've tried the same thing.

MAIN_YHX_121_4: I'm not that child who needed protecting anymore. I have a duty to fulfill. Laihai-Roi is my responsibility.

MAIN_YHX_121_11: {Male=He;Female=She} met people. People who care for {Male=him;Female=her}. Who miss {Male=him;Female=her}. People {Male=he;Female=she} formed connections with.

MAIN_YHX_121_16: …You're the one who taught me that my pain is no different from anyone else's! I can't turn my back on the responsibility I have.

It was during this "road trip" that you ultimately chose to let go, choosing Solaris. Knowing that the current you is also loved by her, you could finally depart without worry, to do what she believes needs to be done, and bear the responsibilities that come with them.
You tried to hold onto the Aemeath, but failed to do so.

MAIN_YHX_131_7:
The Soliskin touches the talisman in your hand before running towards the simulator cockpit. You pass through the crowd to find Aemeath, who died in this very cockpit years ago, now sitting in the pilot's seat.
Joyfully grasping her hand, you suddenly notice her empty eyes staring into quiet, blank nothingness.
MAIN_YHX_132_1: The results are in. It's what I had expected.

MAIN_YHX_133_11: If I follow it… maybe I can find where she is.

MAIN_YHX_133_25:
You arrive at the station, where the Exoswarm resembling Aemeath sits quietly. You speak out to her, hoping the Aemeath far beyond the other side of the gateway can hear your determination: you will bring her home.
